You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Bullseye
entries: Also at 3rd level, you can sink a shot exactly where you need to. Record the number rolled whenever you roll a d20 for a ranged spell attack roll with a warmage cantrip. Rolls that have advantage and disadvantage record the higher and lower d20 roll, respectively. A recorded roll lasts for 1 minute.
If you roll one of your recorded numbers again when making a spell attack roll with a warmage cantrip, you gain one of the following benefits of your choice:
-You can reroll the d20 and must use the new roll. Record this new d20 roll.
-You can deal an extra 1d10 force damage to the target.
-You regain an expended use of your Trick Shot ability.

subclassFeature.name: Flurry Of Blades
entries: Beginning at 7th level, when you cast a cantrip that allows you to make multiple spell attacks, such as force weapon or magic daggers, you can use your bonus action to make one additional spell attack with that cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Intercepting Shot
entries: Starting at 10th level, as a reaction when an attacker you can see within 60 feet makes an attack against you or a friendly creature you can see within 30 feet of you, you can make a ranged spell attack using magic daggers to interrupt the attack. If the result of your roll is greater than the result of the attacker, you can reduce the attack roll targeting you by 5 (to a minimum result of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Vanishing Toss
entries: At 15th level, you master the house's signature technique for recovering darts. Whenever you cast the magic daggers cantrip, you can replace one of your spell attacks with a special Vanishing Toss that embeds a magic dagger in an object you can see within range. You can use your bonus action to teleport to the dagger as long as you are within 500 feet of it. The dagger disappears after 10 minutes or if you use this ability to throw another Vanishing Toss.

subclassFeature.name: Dart Burst
entries: Beginning at 18th level, if you have recorded ten or more unique numbers using your Bullseye feature, you can use your action to clear all of your recorded numbers and throw a burst of darts. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 1d8 force damage for each unique recorded number on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: House Of Go
entries: The renowned House of Go predates the other warmage colleges by centuries. Unlike its successors, the strategies pioneered by the House of Go focus upon formations and cooperation, rather than individual excellence. Which isn't to suggest that warmages of this college are anything other than brilliant strategiststhey rival the House of Kings in this regard. Rather, the footsoldiers of the House of Go are greater than the sum of their parts, fluidly adopting motions to isolate and flank their foes.

subclassFeature.name: Formations
entries: Starting when you choose this house at 3rd level, you learn special tactics called Formations. You can use a bonus action to activate one of the following Formations, which lasts until you and your allies are no longer in that formation, you are incapacitated, die, or you use this feature to activate a different formation.

entries.name: Flank.
entries: You can use this formation when you and an ally that isn't incapacitated are adjacent to a hostile creature and on opposite sides of it. You can determine this by tracing a 5-foot-wide line from your space. If this line passes through the center of all three spaces, the hostile creature is flanked. You and your ally have advantage on attack rolls against the flanked creature.

entries.name: Solo.
entries: You can use this formation when you have no allies within 5 feet of you. While in this formation, if you target a creature with a cantrip, that creature can't make opportunity attacks against you for the rest of the turn or until you are no longer in this formation, whether you deal damage with the cantrip or not.

entries.name: Wall.
entries: You can use this formation when you and two to six allies that aren't incapacitated are within 5 feet of each other. Each creature in this formation (including you), gains a +2 bonus to its Armor Class.

entries.name: Flanking Rules
entries: If your table already uses optional flanking rules, using the Flanking formation gains an additional benefit: you and your ally also have advantage on saving throws you make against effects caused by the flanked creature.

subclassFeature.name: Opening Moves
entries: Starting at 7th level, you can spend 10 minutes planning an encounter in exact detail. When you do so, you can share your plan with up to six allies within 30 feet of you who can hear or see you and who can understand you. Each ally that understands the plan can gain advantage on an attack roll or ability check it makes within the next 10 minutes. If an ally rolls initiative during this time, it can't use this feature to gain advantage after the end of the first round of combat.
Once you use this feature to make a plan, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Hardened Formations
entries: Beginning at 10th level, while you are in a formation, any critical hit against you or an ally in your formation becomes a normal hit.

subclassFeature.name: Chain Of Liberties
entries: By 15th level, your formation moves as if your allies were links in a chain. Whenever you move on your turn, you can spend movement to allow willing allies in your formation to move to locations you choose. You must spend movement separately for each ally you wish to move.

subclassFeature.name: End Game
entries: By 18th level, you can play out the last few moves of the game in rapid succession. On your turn, when you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a warmage cantrip, you can cast another cantrip as a bonus action. You can apply Warmage Edge to this cantrip, even if you have already used it on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: House Of Roulette
entries: Like the Houses of Dice and Cards, warmages of the House of Roulette are masters of the calculated gamble. Bearing a number of magical chips, they can push the odds when the need arises, pulling off longshot plays that other warmages could only dream of.

subclassFeature.name: Spin The Wheel
entries: Starting when you choose this house at 3rd level, you gain a roulette ball infused with arcane energy and a number of chips. As a bonus action, you can conjure a roulette wheel of magical force and roll the ball. Choose one of the bets from the Roulette Bets table below, announce your guess, and roll a d100. You gain the listed benefit if your guess is correct.

entries.caption: Roulette Bets
rows: Odd/Even. Guess whether the roll is even or odd.
You gain a +2 bonus to your AC until the start of your next turn.
High/Low. Guess whether the roll is above or below 50.
You gain a +2 bonus on attack rolls you make until the start of your next turn.
Lanes. Guess which of the following spans the number falls within: 01-20, 21-40, 41-60 , 61-80, 81-00.
You can gain advantage on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw you make before the end of your next turn.
Tens. Guess the 10s digit of the roll.
Once before the end of your next turn, you can add 10 to the damage roll of a warmage spell you cast.
Single. Guess the exact number of the roll.
Until the start of your next turn, you have resistance to all damage and treat any d20 roll you make as 20.

entries.name: Chips of Fate.
entries: You have four Chips of Fate, and regain all expended chips when you finish a long rest. You gain two additional Chips of Fate at 7th level (6 chips total), two more at 10th level (8 chips total), and two more at 15th level (10 chips total).

Whenever you place a bet on the roulette wheel, you can expend one to four of your chips to place additional bets equal to the number of chips expended. No matter how many chips you expend, you can only place two types of bets, such as Singles and Tens, per d100 roll. You can't place more than one Odd/Even or High/Low bets. You can gain two benefits at once if you win two bets on the same roll.

subclassFeature.name: Lucky Number
entries: Beginning at 7th level, you can thumb the scales of fortune in favor of a longshot bet. Pick a Lucky Number from 1 to 100. If you roll that number on any d100 roll of your Spin the Wheel feature, you gain the benefit of betting that number as a Single. You can change your Lucky Number whenever you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Spinning Shield
entries: Starting at 10th level, as a reaction when a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can conjure your roulette wheel between yourself and the attacker. You and the attacker each roll a d100. If your roll is equal or higher, the attack misses, and you can't use this ability again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Cash Out
entries: By 15th level, you can unleash the energy stored within a Chip of Fate to escape a tight spot. As a bonus action, you can expend a Chip of Fate to teleport up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space you can see.

subclassFeature.name: Everything On Black
entries: Starting at 18th level, you regain 4 expended Chips of Fate whenever you roll initiative. Additionally, whenever you expend one or more Chips of Fate to bet on a Single and win, you regain all of your expended Chips of Fate.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The demon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Cohort
entries: While following the command of a captain, the demon gains additional abilities based on the captain's level:

2nd. Action: Spellcasting. The demon casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC equals the captain's maneuver save DC):
1/day each: {@spell command}, {@spell detect magic}
6th. Improved Armor. The demon's Armor Class increases by 1.
6th. Abyssal Infusion. The demon's claws and hurl flame attack each deal an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage on a hit.
6th: Action: Spellcasting. The demon's Spellcasting improves. It can cast the following spells in addition to those in its statistics:
1/day each: {@spell darkness}, {@spell hold person}
10th. Flight. The demons gains a flying speed of 60 feet.
10th: Action: Spellcasting. The demon's Spellcasting improves. It can cast the following spells in addition to those in its statistics:
1/day each: {@spell fear}, {@spell fireball}
14th. Improved Armor. The demon's Armor Class increases by 1.
14th. Abyssal Infusion. The demon's claws and hurl flame attack each now deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a hit.

18th. Fire Aura. At the start of each of the demon's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. The demon can choose to suppress this aura.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hurl Flame
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) fire damage.

trait.name: Demiplane Dwelling
entries: The walking hut contains an entrance to a 30-foot radius demiplane furnished as a rustic household. The demiplane is dimly-lit, comfortable, and dry, regardless of the weather outside.

When the hut dies, creatures inside the demiplane are expelled into the open spaces nearest to the entrance. The hut's creator can also use its action to magically expel creatures it chooses from the demiplane.

ActionsSlam. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}

monster.name: Duskfog
languages: understands all the languages of its creator

trait.name: Misty Form
entries: The duskfog can occupy another creature's space and vice versa. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the duskfog can pass through it without squeezing. Each foot of movement in water costs it 2 extra feet, rather than 1 extra foot. The duskfog can't manipulate objects in any way that requires fingers or manual dexterity.

ActionsMisty Embrace. Melee Spell Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) necrotic damage and the duskfog regains hit points equal to half of the necrotic damage dealt.

monster.name: Slaymate
languages: the languages known by its creator

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the slaymate remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal toy.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The slaymate can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a person whispering, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful {@dc 11} Wisdom (Insight) check.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Two-Handed
entries: The bolter counts as having two hands with which to wield its installed weapon. The bolter can only use ranged weapons.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

hp.special: 3 + three times your craftsman level (the drake has a number of Hit Dice [d6s] equal to your craftsman level)

trait.name: One-Handed
entries: The macer counts as having one hand with which to wield its installed weapon. The macer can only use melee weapons.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Renaissance firearms.

When you make a ranged attack against a target within the weapon's normal range and miss, you can spend a risk die as a reaction and deal damage to the target equal to the roll on the die. This ability deals no damage if the attack roll misses the target's AC by 10 or more.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Renaissance firearms.
As a reaction when a hostile creature within 30 feet from you moves, you can expend a risk die to move up to your movement speed.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Industrial Age firearms.

You can impressively twirl your weapons to impress others. Whenever you make a Charisma ({@skill Performance}) check or a Dexterity ({@skill Sleight of Hand}) check using one of your ranged weapons, you can expend a risk die and add it to the ability check.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Industrial Age firearms.
As a reaction when you make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can expend one risk die and add it to saving throw.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Modern firearms.
When you make an attack with a ranged weapon against a target within the weapon's normal range, you can expend a risk die to ignore half and three-quarters cover.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Modern firearms.

As a reaction when a creature within 15 feet of you is targeted by a ranged attack, you can spend a risk die to dive in the way of the bullet. You move next to the creature and become the target of the attack. If you are hit, you can subtract the risk die from the damage taken.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Futuristic firearms.
While you are in total cover, you can expend a risk die as a bonus action to make one ranged weapon attack with disadvantage against any target within the weapon's range.

entries.name: Variant Deeds
entries: With the GM's permission, you can pick the following two Deeds in place of two of your normal Deeds, if you are in a setting that primarily uses Futuristic firearms.

Once per turn when you make a ranged weapon attack, you can spend a risk die to hide the source of the attack. Though this does not silence the attack, it does obscure other markers of the attack, such as muzzle flare, which might implicate you as the attacker. Make a Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check and add the risk die to the roll, opposed by the highest passive {@skill Perception} score of the spectators. On a success, no spectator to the attack can identify its source.

optionalfeature.name: Blackjack

subclass.name: House of Cards, Darts, Dice, or Roulette

entries: When you cast a cantrip that requires a single spell attack roll and you don't have disadvantage on the roll, you can choose to roll with advantage. The attack automatically misses if the sum of the two rolled dice exceeds 21, and it is a critical hit if the sum equals 21.

optionalfeature.name: Commander's Steed
entries: You learn the find steed spell and can cast it at will without expending a spell slot. Your steed is more resilient than most; its hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your warmage level.

optionalfeature.name: Contingent Cantrip
entries: When you finish a long rest, you can spend 10 minutes performing a ritual to create a contingent cantrip. Cast a warmage cantrip that has a casting time of 1 action or 1 bonus action and doesn't deal damage. The cantrip doesn't take effect immediately, but instead it takes effect the next time you speak a specified command word (no action required). When you perform this ritual, choose whether the cantrip targets you, the nearest friendly creature, or the nearest hostile creature. The cantrip can't use other warmage tricks when it comes into effect.
You can only have one contingent cantrip at a time.
If you perform this ritual again, the previous contingent cantrip ends.

optionalfeature.name: Gamble

subclass.name: House of Cards, Darts, Dice, or Roulette

entries: You are always under the effects of the cheat cantrip.
Additionally, you can reroll an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw and must use the new roll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Magic Moment
entries: When you cast moment to think, you can choose to also stop time for a willing or {@condition unconscious} creature you can see within 30 feet. The creature can take one of the actions permitted by the spell during your turn, and you can interact with one another while time is stopped. During this time you can exchange items, swap locations, take the {@action Help} action for tasks while time is stopped, attempt to stabilize a dying creature, or have a short conversation without eavesdropping or interruption.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Retort
entries: You learn the {@spell vicious mockery} cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.

Additionally, when a creature you can see makes an attack roll against you, you can cast vicious mockery targeting that creature as a reaction. If the creature fails its saving throw, the cantrip imposes disadvantage on the triggering attack roll, instead of the creature's next attack roll, potentially causing the attack to miss.
Once you cast this cantrip as a reaction, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Prismatic Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you deal force damage with a warmage cantrip, you can roll a {@dice d6} on the following table to change the cantrip's damage type for this casting.
You can apply tricks to the casting as normal using the new damage type.
Additionally, you can apply the trick corresponding to the rolled damage type, even if you don't know the trick. You can do so twice and regain all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Radiant Cantrip
entries: Once on each of your turns, when you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, poison, or thunder, you can change the damage type to radiant. You can reroll one of the cantrip's damage dice and must use the new roll.
The number of damage dice you can reroll increases by 1 when you reach 11th level (2 dice) and 17th level (3 dice).

optionalfeature.name: Residual Cantrip
entries: When you cast a cantrip that deals damage and requires a single spell attack roll and you miss, you can channel some of the residual magic into a secondary beam of arcane energy as a bonus action. Make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within the cantrip's range. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d6} damage of the cantrip's damage type. This beam doesn't count as a cantrip.
This damage increases to {@dice 1d8} when you reach 5th level, to {@dice 1d10} when you reach 11th level, and to {@dice 1d12} when you reach 17th level.

optionalfeature.name: Capture

entries.name: Capture
entries: You can use this formation when you and three or more allies that aren't {@condition incapacitated} are adjacent to a hostile creature and surround it. You can determine this by placing an imaginary cube around the hostile creature. If you and your allies are adjacent to each side of the cube, the creature is surrounded.

When you activate this formation, the hostile creature must make a Dexterity saving throw against your warmage spell save DC or be enveloped by chains of magical force and {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. At the end of each of the creature's turns, it can make a Dexterity saving throw, freeing itself and ending this formation on a success.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Chips are Down
entries: When you expend one or more Chips of Fate to bet and lose at least one bet, you regain one expended Chips of Fate.

optionalfeature.name: Dartmaster
entries: When you cast a cantrip that allows you to make multiple ranged spell attacks, such as magic daggers or force dart using the Split Fire trick, and you miss with one or more attacks, you can reroll all of your misses.
Once you use this trick, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
